text:
Hi Everyone,

I been testing changing the design of the "Read More" button for a RSS email and hoping someone can shed some light on adding a CSS class to give to a better style.I created a button call Continue reading. How can I add the CSS class to style this to a button in the head html of the email?Not sure how to target it and ad some basic style

"<a href="{{post.url}}"><button type="button">Continue Here</button> </a>" works its now just to style it and not sure how to add the CSS to do this.

<https://ibb.co/MD0bcKp>

<@UFYKWK0R4> I think you’re going to want to get a developer to help you. your readmore is put in as a form button. That’s not going to do anything in most email clients. What you need is a link styled to look like a button. You do that by adding css to the head of the email OR you could use a CTA which would be inserted as an image.

Your html that you pasted also has some odd spacing inside of the html tags. I’ve never seen someone do that, I have a feeling outlook would likely choke on that, I can’t say for certain without testing, just from experience that looks problematic.

your image size is too small (i.e 640 x 240). When you preview it on big screen it streched thats why  it looks blurr. If you will use big size (1920*1080). then i think it will looks good on big screen.

Hey guys are there any best practices around implementing responsive design in HubSpot, I am confused by the extra layer of magic offered by HubSpot at 768px and how I should change it or adapt to it ?
that’s added by layout.css for drag n drop templates. basically you just override the css if you need to.
any reason that a js function would work if it is in the html pane, but doesnt work in js pane?
missing dependency?
i am calling it with an button onclick.  console says that the function is missing
but i add the script into the html pane, it all good.
no se
Hey guys, any ideas why this keeps happening? We're trying to copy over a template page on another portal..
Note that this is a drag and drop template page with custom modules on it just to get a better picture..
not sure on the api exception part but
when you’re doing the copying are you choosing to exclude anything? that used to reliably always bomb if you tried to exclude say a js or css file that was a dependency
easier to just copy with those assets and remove
Is this just in the editor?
what do you mean?
it works in the html pane of the editor and not the js pane
and it is just with functions
I was wondering if you were just having trouble with preview or if it’s a problem with preview and live.
Not sure if that would actually matter, just throwing things out to see if it sparks something for you.
ah.  i have it on a staged page live
thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
Could it be a scoping issue?
just going to chalk it up to bad luck.  it is working in a script tag.
Alright, fair enough.
if it happens elsewhere, i will get concerned.  has never been an issue before
thanks for the help, though
you’re welcome
I've just did that but still no luck. Thanks anyways <@U7SL518D6>. Maybe we'd try other approach or trim things down bit by bit and see what is causing this. I'll give a shout once we figure this out
If it’s a template, I’m gunna guess the issue is in one of the modules loaded into it by default
Yeah, that probably might be causing that. We have a number of modules so I guess one of those is the culprit
Okay, so we've found out the culprit - it's the HTML module inside a global group :man-facepalming:
cc <@U6W3H6YN8>
